etymology.description: 小 (small; young) + 妹妹 (younger sister) = little sister; young girl.
etymology.interpretation: Literally “small younger-sister,” used for one’s younger sister or as a friendly way to refer to a young girl. In address, it can sound affectionate or casual depending on context.

parts.english: younger sister; little sister; young girl (colloquial); girl (informal address)

examples.chinese: 我有一个小妹妹(我有一個小妹妹)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yǒu yí gè xiǎo mèimei.

examples.chinese: 她还是小妹妹，所以不能独自回家(她還是小妹妹，所以不能獨自回家)。
examples.pinyin: Tā hái shì xiǎo mèimei, suǒyǐ bùnéng dúzì huíjiā.
examples.english: She’s still a young girl, so she can’t go home alone.

examples.chinese: 阿姨对那位小妹妹很亲切(阿姨對那位小妹妹很親切)。
examples.pinyin: Āyí duì nà wèi xiǎo mèimei hěn qīnqiè.
examples.english: The lady is very kind to that little girl.
